question: 化繊
sourceMnemonic:
<kanji>Fiber</kanji>s that have been <kanji>change</kanji>d from other materials are <vocabulary>synthetic fibers</vocabulary>. They aren't natural because they were something else once. Like plastic, or kittens.

Note that this is an abbreviation of the specialist term <ja>化学繊維</ja>, and it mostly comes up in industrial contexts.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
